uk.co.strangeskies.modabi.processing

Interface BindingBlocker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BindingBlocksImpl

    public interface BindingBlocker
    BindingBlocks are intended to signal that a binding thread is waiting for resources or dependencies to be made available by some external process. Blocks should not be made if the resource is already available, even if released immediately.

    This class contains methods to create blocks over Functions from, and Consumers of BindingBlock. The block is created, then the given function or consumer should fetch the resource, or wait for it to be available.

    Any BindingBlock which is currently blocking will prevent completion of the owning BindingFuture until the given runnable process completes, or until invocation of BindingBlock.complete(). The process will be completed on the invoking thread, so invocation returns only after the supplier completes execution and the block is lifted.

    Unless otherwise specified to be internal, blocks may be satisfied by external processes, so if a block is still in place when binding otherwise completes, with no internal processing threads remaining unblocked, then the binding will simply wait until the dependency becomes available.

    The thread which the given blocking process is invoked on will always terminate after invocation, and after releasing the block.

      • addInternalProcessingThread

        void addInternalProcessingThread(Thread processingThread)
        Register a thread which is participating in the binding/unbinding process. This helps the processor determine whether there is unblocked activity, or otherwise detect a deadlock or unsatisfied dependency.
        Parameters:
        processingThread - The thread participating in processing
